snippet: A fatal attack has brought new scrutiny to a strip, beside a popular Manhattan park, where clients of drug treatment clinics hang out.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column observes that eastern edge of Manhattan's Union Square Park has remained hangout for panhandlers, hustlers and clients of drug treatment clinics, despite cleanup in most of the park; strip has faced new scrutiny after September incident in which Martin Redrick punched stranger 62-year-old Jeffrey Babbitt, resulting in Babbit's death when he fell and struck his head.
lead_paragraph: A fatal attack has brought new scrutiny to a strip, beside a popular Manhattan park, where clients of drug treatment clinics hang out.

headline.main: Near Union Square Greenmarket and a Playground, Methadone Alley
headline.print_headline: It’s No Longer a Needle Park, but It Still Has a Methadone Alley
